colorectal.name: Colonoscopy with Biopsy
colorectal.description: A colonoscopy is a procedure that screens the patient for colorectal cancer.

colorectal.name: Fissurectomy
colorectal.description: A fissurectomy is used to treat anal fissures. This procedure removes the edges of the fissure, any skin tags that may have occurred in conjunction with chronic tears. A cauterizing tool is then used to seal the entire area of the wound.

colorectal.name: Hemorroidectomy
colorectal.description: Surgical removal of internal or external hemorrhoids. Hemorrhoids occur when veins in the anus area become inflammed. Surgical correction is accomplished by cutting around the tissue and tying off the vein to prevent bleeding or utilizing a surgical stapler to reposition the hemorroid and cut off the blood flow causing the inflammation.

ent.name: Adenoidectomy
ent.description: Surgical removal of the adenoids. Adenoids are lymph tissue located behind the nasal passages that help the body by producing antibodies that fight infection.

ent.name: Adenoidectomy/Tympanostomy with Tube Insertion
ent.description: Tympanostomy tube: Insertion of small tube into eardrum to ventilate the middle ear and prevent accumulation of fluid. Myringotomy: Incision in tympanic membrane in order to ventilate the middle ear, drain fluid from the membrane, or to obtain cultures (in the case of infection).

ent.name: Bilateral Myringotomy and Tubes
ent.description: Small incisions are made in both eardrums. Tubes are inserted to drain fluid and ventilate the middle ears.

ent.name: Excision of Mass
ent.description: A mass is surgically removed. Tissue is extracted to be examined.

ent.name: Septoplasty (Simple)
ent.description: Corrective surgical procedure to treat a deviated septum that may be causing breathing difficulties. An incision is made in the lining of the septum in order to reach the targeted cartilage/bone in question. The septum is straightened and temporarily stabilized using internal plastic tubes, splits or sutures.

ent.name: Tonsillectomy
ent.description: Tonsillectomy Surgical removal of the two oval shaped pads of tissue on either side of the the back of the throat. Tonsils are part of the lymphatic system of the body which helps to fight infection. A doctor may recommend removal of the tonsils when you experience repeated tonsillitis or when enlarged tonsils cause snoring or repeated sleep disruption.

ent.name: Tonsillectomy/Adenoidectomy
ent.description: Surgical removal of both the tonsils and adenoids.

gastro.name: Colonoscopy with Biopsy
gastro.description: A colonoscopy is a procedure that screens the patient for colorectal cancer.

gastro.name: EGD with biopsy
gastro.description: An upper GI endoscopy, also known as an upper endoscopy or EGD, is a medical procedure in which your doctor, usually a gastroenterologist, examines the lining of your upper digestive system through a tiny camera attached to a long, flexible tube called an endoscope.

gastro.name: EGD with Colonoscopy
gastro.description: EGD is an examination of the lining of the stomach, esophagus, and small intestine and large intestine.

general-surgery.name: Anal Fistula
general-surgery.description: Surgical removal of an anal fistula, a small tunnel between the end of the bowel and the skin near the anus, by a fistulotomy or seton procedures.

general-surgery.name: Excision Of Mass
general-surgery.description: Excision of a mass involves the surgical removal of abnormal tissue or growth from the body.

general-surgery.name: Hemorroidectomy
general-surgery.description: Surgical removal of internal or external hemorrhoids. Hemorrhoids occur when veins in the anus area become inflamed. Surgical correction is accomplished by cutting around the tissue and tying off the vein to prevent bleeding or utilizing a surgical stapler to reposition the hemorrhoid and cut off the blood flow causing the inflammation.

general-surgery.name: Hernia Repair - Epigastric
general-surgery.description: Hernia surgery is when a surgeon closes the rupture during abdominal surgery. Surgeons can do this through Herniorrhaphy (tissue or muscle repair) or Hernioplasty (mesh repair).

general-surgery.name: Hernia Repair - Inguinal
general-surgery.description: Hernia surgery is when a surgeon closes the rupture during abdominal surgery. Surgeons can do this through Herniorrhaphy (tissue or muscle repair) or Hernioplasty (mesh repair).

general-surgery.name: Hernia Repair - Inguinal Bilateral
general-surgery.description: Hernia surgery is when a surgeon closes the rupture during abdominal surgery. Surgeons can do this through Herniorrhaphy (tissue or muscle repair) or Hernioplasty (mesh repair).

general-surgery.name: Hernia Repair - Laparoscopic
general-surgery.description: Hernia surgery is when a surgeon closes the rupture during abdominal surgery. Surgeons can do this through Herniorrhaphy (tissue or muscle repair) or Hernioplasty (mesh repair).

general-surgery.name: Hernia Repair - Ventricular/Umbilical
general-surgery.description: Hernia surgery is when a surgeon closes the rupture during abdominal surgery. Surgeons can do this through Herniorrhaphy (tissue or muscle repair) or Hernioplasty (mesh repair).

general-surgery.name: Laparoscopic Appendectomy
general-surgery.description: Surgical removal of the appendix (small pouch attached to the large intestine) in order to treat appendicitis (inflammatory condition of the appendix).

general-surgery.name: Laparoscopic Cholecystectomy
general-surgery.description: Surgery to remove the gallbladder, also known as a cholecystectomy, is most often performed to treat gallstones and the complications they cause.

general-surgery.name: Pilonidal Cyst
general-surgery.description: Removal of a pilonidal cyst involves extracting a fluid-filled lump that forms near the tailbone or buttocks.

general-surgery.name: Port Placement
general-surgery.description: Implantation under the skin of a port or device to allow easy access for patients undergoing chemotherapy, intravenous medication administration, or transfusions.

general-surgery.name: Port Removal
general-surgery.description: Incision is made to remove a port that has been inserted into the chest for chemotherapy treatment.

general-surgery.name: Thyroidectomy
general-surgery.description: Thyroidectomy is the surgical removal of part or all of the thyroid and parathyroid gland.

gynecology.name: Diagnostic Laparoscopy
gynecology.description: Examination of the abdomen via use of a laparoscopic device. A surgeon makes a small incision through the abdominal wall and passes a laparoscope (surgical device with video camera) into the abdominal area in order to view organs and abdominal contents.

gynecology.name: Dilation & Curettage
gynecology.description: A surgical procedure to remove tissue from the inside of the uterus (lining).

gynecology.name: Hysterectomy, Laparoscopic
gynecology.description: A hysterectomy is a surgery to remove a woman's uterus. In a laparoscopic hysterectomy, the surgeon makes several small incisions in the abdomen and inserts a tiny camera and surgical tools to remove the uterus through the incisions.

gynecology.name: Hysteroscopy, Novasure
gynecology.description: A hysterectomy is a surgical procedure in which a woman's uterus is removed. Novasure is a minimally invasive method that uses radiofrequency energy to treat abnormal uterine bleeding by permanently removing the lining of the uterus.

gynecology.name: Tubal Ligation
gynecology.description: A surgical procedure to cut, block or tie a women’s fallopian tubes in order to prevent future pregnancies.

gynecology.name: Tubal Reversal, Open
gynecology.description: Fallopian tubes are opened with a stent and the separated sections are reconnected with microsurgical sutures. Can be performed following tubal ligation procedure (tubes tied).

orthopedic.name: Achilles Tendon Repair
orthopedic.description: Surgical repair and reattachment of the Achilles tendon that has been separated due to injury.

orthopedic.name: Anterior Cruciate Ligament Repair/Reconstruction w/ graft
orthopedic.description: Removal of the anterior cruciate ligament in the knee and replacement with tissue graft. Performed to restore function after injury.

orthopedic.name: Anterior Cruciate Ligament Repair/Reconstruction without graft
orthopedic.description: Removal of the anterior cruciate ligament in the knee. Performed to restore function after injury.

orthopedic.name: Carpel Tunnel Release Open vs Endo
orthopedic.description: Surgical repair and reattachment of the Achilles tendon that has been separated due to injury.

orthopedic.name: Closed Reduction/Casting
orthopedic.description: Realign the bones and set them in place with a cast to heal correctly; one of the most common treatment methods for broken bones.

orthopedic.name: Complex Fracture Repair, Plates/Screws
orthopedic.description: Bone fracture repair is surgery to fix a broken bone using metal screws, pins, rods, or plates to hold the bone in place.

orthopedic.name: Dupuytrens Contracture Release
orthopedic.description: Thickened connective tissue in the hand caused by Dupuytren’s contracture (progressive hand deformity) is either removed or cut and divided up to regain the movement of fingers.

orthopedic.name: Excision Ganglion Cyst
orthopedic.description: Surgical removal of a ganglion cyst from the joint through excision. Associated joint capsule and/or tendon sheath may also be removed.

orthopedic.name: Excision of Neuroma
orthopedic.description: Surgical removal of a neuroma (swollen nerve).

orthopedic.name: Knee Arthroscopy
orthopedic.description: Knee arthroscopy is an orthopedic surgical technique that doctors use to diagnose and treat problems in the knee joint.

orthopedic.name: Shoulder Arthroscopy (Labral repair)
orthopedic.description: Shoulder arthroscopy is surgery that uses a tiny camera called an arthroscope to examine or repair the tissues inside or around your shoulder joint.

orthopedic.name: Shoulder Arthroscopy Rotator Cuff Repair (arthroscopic)
orthopedic.description: Shoulder arthroscopy is surgery that uses a tiny camera called an arthroscope to examine or repair the tissues inside or around your shoulder joint.

orthopedic.name: Shoulder Arthroscopy(Subacromial decompression)(Distal clavicle resection)
orthopedic.description: Shoulder arthroscopy is surgery that uses a tiny camera called an arthroscope to examine or repair the tissues inside or around your shoulder joint.

orthopedic.name: Simple Fracture Repair, Perc Pinning
orthopedic.description: Procedure involving simple fracture repair with percutaneous pinning.

orthopedic.name: Total Knee Arthroplasty
orthopedic.description: Pricing includes the implant. At the Surgeon’s discretion, the procedure will be robotic-assisted.

pain-management.name: Celiac Plexus Nerve Block
pain-management.description: Surgical procedure performed to reduce abdominal pain caused by chronic diseases such as cancer, pancreatitis, or adhesions. Local anesthetic is injected to block celiac plexus nerves transmitting pain signals.

pain-management.name: Epidural Steroid Injection (Cervical, Thoracic, Lumbar)
pain-management.description: Injection into the epidural space surrounding the spinal sac to decrease pain and inflammation. Steroids provide anti-inflammatory action, breaking the cycle of pain and allowing the body to compensate for underlying conditions.

pain-management.name: Facet Joint Injection (Cervical/Lumbar) 1 Level
pain-management.description: Treatment locating and treating the source of pain in facet joints, facilitating rehabilitation. Anesthetic and/or steroid medication is injected into two points in the facet joint to anesthetize and block pain.

pain-management.name: Facet Joint Injection (Cervical/Lumbar) 2 Level
pain-management.description: Procedure to locate and treat the source of pain in facet joints, aiding rehabilitation. Anesthetic and/or steroid medication is injected into one point in the facet joint to anesthetize and block pain.

pain-management.name: Facet Joint Injection (Cervical/Lumbar) 3 Level
pain-management.description: Injection of anesthetic and anti-inflammatory medication into facet joints to relieve inflammation and pain caused by osteoarthritis or injury.

pain-management.name: Facet Joint RFA
pain-management.description: Surgical removal of tumors or dysfunctional tissue using heat generated from radio frequency current. The procedure involves placing a needle-like RFA probe inside the tumor.

pain-management.name: Lumbar Sympathetic Nerve Block
pain-management.description: Procedure to block sympathetic nerves causing pain in the lower extremities. Local anesthetic is injected around the sympathetic nerves to prevent them from carrying pain information back to the spinal cord.

pain-management.name: Occipital Nerve Block for Headache
pain-management.description: Injection of a steroid or other medication around the greater and lesser occipital nerves to alleviate inflammation causing headaches or migraines.

pain-management.name: SI Joint RFA
pain-management.description: Injection of anesthetic and anti-inflammatory medication into sacroiliac joint to alleviate pain, inflammation, and restore motion.

pain-management.name: Steroid Injection Knee
pain-management.description: Injection of pain-relieving medication below the kneecap to relieve stiffness, pain, and inflammation caused by osteoarthritis.

pain-management.name: Supraorbital Nerve Block
pain-management.description: Injection of depot steroid into supraorbital nerve to aid repair of lacerations or excisions of the scalp.

pain-management.name: Trigger Point Injection
pain-management.description: Injection of anesthetic or corticosteroid directly into the area identified as a 'trigger point' of pain.

plastic-surgery.name: Abdominoplasty
plastic-surgery.description: Cosmetic surgical procedure in which excess skin and fat is removed from the middle and lower abdomen in order to improve tone, firmness, and overall appearance. Also known as a 'tummy tuck'. The procedure also helps to restore weakened or separated muscles, so to create a stronger, flatter tummy.

plastic-surgery.name: Blepharoplasty Upper and Lower
plastic-surgery.description: Cosmetic surgical procedure in which excess skin and pockets of fat are removed from the upper and lower eyelids. This helps to correct loose, sagging skin around the eye area and create a more youthful look. Also known as an ‘eye lift’.

plastic-surgery.name: Blepharoplasty Upper or Lower
plastic-surgery.description: Cosmetic surgical procedure in which excess skin and pockets of fat are removed from the upper and lower eyelids. This helps to correct loose, sagging skin around the eye area and create a more youthful look. Also known as an ‘eye lift’.

plastic-surgery.name: Breast Augmentation (Saline)
plastic-surgery.description: Cosmetic surgical procedure in which a saline implant is placed behind the breast and/or chest muscle to increase the volume and appearance of the breast. Breast augmentation may also replace volume lost due to breastfeeding or weight loss, or to improve the shape of the breast. A saline implant consists of a silicone shell that is inserted into the body and then filled to its desired volume with saline fluid.

plastic-surgery.name: Breast Augmentation (Silicone)
plastic-surgery.description: Cosmetic surgical procedure in which a silicone implant is placed behind the breast and/or chest muscle to increase the volume and appearance of the breast. Breast augmentation may also replace volume lost due to breastfeeding or weight loss, or to improve the shape of the breast. Silicone gel is an inert polymer consisting of molecules stuck to one another in a cohesive matrix.

podiatry.name: Bunionectomy
podiatry.description: Surgical removal of the enlargement (bone and tissue) located at the base of the big toe, known as a bunion.

podiatry.name: Excision of Neuroma
podiatry.description: Procedure for the removal of a neuroma, with no specific description provided.

podiatry.name: Haglunds
podiatry.description: Resection of Haglunds Deformity involves removing the bony bump on the back of the calcaneus or heel bone.

podiatry.name: Instep / Fasciotomy
podiatry.description: Procedure with no specific description provided.

podiatry.name: Osteotomy
podiatry.description: Procedure with no specific description provided.

podiatry.name: Platelet-Rich Plasma Injection
podiatry.description: Procedure with no specific description provided.

podiatry.name: Toe Amputation
podiatry.description: Procedure with no specific description provided.

spine.name: ACDF 1 level
spine.description: Removal of one damaged or herniated disc to relieve pressure on spinal cord or nerve root and alleviate corresponding pain, weakness, numbness, and tingling.

spine.name: ACDF 2 level
spine.description: Removal of two damaged or herniated discs to relieve pressure on spinal cord or nerve root and alleviate corresponding pain, weakness, numbness, and tingling.

spine.name: Laminectomy Lumbar 1 level
spine.description: Removal of a small portion of bone over the nerve root and/or disc material from under the nerve root. Performed to alleviate pain caused by lumbar spinal stenosis (enlarged facet joints placing pressure on nerves).

spine.name: Lumbar Fusion 1 level
spine.description: Surgical procedure in which one vertebrae (spinal discs) of the spine is permanently fused together to prevent painful motion and provide stability following injury, disease, or natural aging.

spine.name: Lumbar Fusion 2 level
spine.description: Surgical procedure in which two vertebrae (spinal discs) of the spine are permanently fused together to prevent painful motion and provide stability following injury, disease, or natural aging.

spine.name: Microdisectomy 1 level
spine.description: Removal of lumbar herniated disc material causing pressure on nerve root or spinal cord. Performed with a microscope to view disc and nerves and allow for a smaller incision.

spine.name: Superion Indirect Decompression System
spine.description: During this procedure, your doctor will implant the superion device (a small expandable spacer) through a small incision in the lower back into the affected area of the spinal canal. When expanded, the device relieves the compression on the spine experienced by patients with lumbar spinal stenosis. The procedure takes between 30 to 45 minutes with very little recovery time. This may be the best treatment option for patients who have failed to find relief through more conservative treatment options.

urology.name: Circumcision
urology.description: A circumcision is a surgical procedure involving the removal of the foreskin from the penis.

urology.name: Cystoscopy
urology.description: A cystoscopy is a procedure that examines the linings of the bladder and urethra to diagnose and treat urinary tract issues.

urology.name: Cystoscopy with Lithotripsy
urology.description: A combination procedure involving cystoscopy and laser lithotripsy to break kidney stones in the urinary tract.

urology.name: ESWL (Lithotripsy Extracorporeal Shockwave)
urology.description: Extracorporeal shock wave lithotripsy (ESWL) is a non-invasive method that uses shock waves to break kidney stones.

urology.name: Orchiectomy
urology.description: Orchiectomy is the surgical removal of one or both testicles.

urology.name: Ureteroscopy
urology.description: Ureteroscopy is a diagnostic and treatment procedure using a small scope inserted into the bladder and ureter to address urinary tract issues.

urology.name: Vasectomy
urology.description: A vasectomy is a minimally invasive operation for men to prevent pregnancy by blocking sperm from reaching semen during ejaculation.
